Subject: Business Management

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Foodz manufactures a variety of frozen savoury food items that are not offered
by any of its competitors. Recently, Sammah's Foodz has introduced new technology with
the goal of broadening its range of products and reducing levels of waste in its
food-production process. These changes have been met with resistance by Sammah's
Foodz employees.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Describe one of the key elements of the operations system at Sammah's Foodz.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Describe one low-risk strategy that could be used at Sammah's Foodz to overcome
employee resistance to change.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain how Sammah's Foodz could minimise waste through the use of
reuse and recycle' in its production process.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Discuss the use of Porter's dif erentiation approach to strategic management at
Foodz as it seeks to increase its number of sales.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Surf 'n Stuff manufactures a range of surfing-related clothing and equipment, such as
wetsuits, swimwear and surfboards. The CEO of Surf 'n Stuff, Sandy Waters, and the
executive management have set the following objectives for the business during 2024:
» toincrease net profit by 10%
« to improve the quality of swimwear by reducing the number of defective outputs by 20%
« toreduce the rate of staff absenteeism to 2% per year.
Sandy Waters has learned about the principles of the Learning Organisation (Senge) and
would like to apply this approach in order to create a positive culture for change within
the business. Sandy believes that this will ensure that everyone is working towards the
achievement of the business's objectives.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Define the term 'quality' in relation to operations management.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Compare the business concepts of effectiveness and efficiency.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain how either artificial intelligence or computer-aided design could be used to
improve efficiency at Surf 'n Stuff.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain how Surf''n Stuff could apply two principles of Senge's Learning Organisation
to develop a positive culture for change.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Allygant Attire specialises in hiring out formal wear for special events, such as weddings
and other celebrations. The business has spent a large amount of money advertising
online to attract new customers. During the next 12 months, Allygant Attire plans to close
six of its Australian stores located in shopping centres and focus more on developing its
website to enable online services.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Describe one way Allygant Attire could improve its corporate social responsibility
within its operations management system.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain two restraining forces for Allygant At ire in relation to developing its website to
enable online services.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Justify the use of the Three-step Change Model (Lewin) when implementing change
at Allygant At ire.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Analyse how the management of employees can affect the achievement of business objectives.
In your response, refer to:
« strategies that are used to manage employees
atleast one contemporary business case study.

Subject: Business Management

to establish and maintain its reputation for offering high-quality rock-climbing experiences in a safe
environment. For the past year, the business has relied on employees with limited experience in the
climbing industry.
During December 2023, three negative reviews of the business appeared online.

The market share for this business is based on the number of sales relative to other rock-climbing
centres in the city.
Mia held a meeting and told staff that the following decisions had been made:
All staff must attend training in the correct use of the rock-climbing equipment. The training will be
held on three consecutive Sundays. The centre wil be closed to make this training possible.
Afirst-aid room wil be created on the ground floor and a trained first-aid provider will be employed
during busy periods. The first-aid room will replace the existing staffroom.
Equipment that is rarely used wil be returned to its local suppliers. The business will purchase more
of the high-demand equipment from overseas, rather than from its regular local suppliers.

identified above.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Section A: Section A

Subject: Business Management
Content: Instructions

Subject: Business Management
Content: Answer all questions in the spaces provided.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Write your responses in English.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Doggy Dugout is a small pet supply business specialising in the sale of pet accessories
such as collars and food bowls. The business operates in a highly competitive market. The
owners of Doggy Dugout have decided to sell the business to a larger company. They are
looking forward to beginning their retirement as soon as possible. Many of their employees
are worried that the change of ownership will lead to redundancies.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Outline one difference between retirement and redundancy as forms of termination.

Subject: Business Management
Content: Describe one driving force that led to the change at Doggy Dugout.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain one advantage and one disadvantage of using high-risk strategies to
overcome employee resistance to change.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Perfecto Pilates offers pilates and yoga classes with a team of experienced and qualified
instructors. Sam, the manager, uses a persuasive management style. Six months ago,
Sam implemented a new roster for staff, reducing hours of work for most instructors. At
staff meeting, Sam explained the benefits of the change for the business. The employees
were disappointed with the decision and it led to a lengthy dispute. The dispute was
settled at the Fair Work Commission. The corporate culture at Perfecto Pilates has been
negatively affected by the dispute.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Describe how Sam has used the management skill of decision-making at
Perfecto Pilates.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Describe one dispute resolution process that could have been used at
Perfecto Pilates. 

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Propose and justify one strategy that could be implemented at Perfecto Pilates to
develop a positive corporate culture.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain the importance of corporate social responsibility considerations when
implementing change.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Analyse the importance of leadership in change management. In your response, refer to at least one
contemporary business case study.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Ready VEG Meals manufactures a range of vegetarian and vegan meals, which it sells
directly to the public. The business has received some negative customer reviews about
the quality of its meals. A recent review of Ready VEG Meals's performance by senior
management has revealed a concerning increase in the level of wastage. The managers
are considering implementing a number of changes, including Total Quality Management
and performance-related pay.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain why an increase in the level of wastage would be of concern to
Ready VEG Meals.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain how Total Quality Management could be used at Ready VEG Meals to reduce
the number of negative customer reviews.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Discuss how performance-related pay could be used as a motivation strategy at
Ready VEG Meals.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
'Businesses must consider how to effectively and efficiently produce a final good or service in
competitive, global environment.'
With reference to the statement above, examine how businesses could operate effectively and
efficiently by using each of the following global considerations:
•	 global sourcing of inputs
•	 overseas manufacture
•	 global outsourcing.
End of Section

Subject: Business Management
Content: Section B: Case study

Subject: Business Management
Content: Instructions

Subject: Business Management
Content: Use the case study provided to answer the questions in this section. Answers must apply to the

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Maxi Mini Golf is one of three minigolf courses operating in the Melbourne suburb of Williamstown.
The manager, Norma Griggs, has noticed that staffing costs have increased significantly in the last
three years. This has inspired her to rethink the way she manages Maxi Mini Golf.
After seeking input from her staff, Norma has decided that by the end of 2025, the business will
make the following changes:
Two automated pay stations will be installed.
Golf clubs will be left on the course for customers to find and use when they arrive.
Golf balls will be provided by an automated machine when customers pay.
Six new holes will be designed and installed by an expert team.
Fewer staff will be rostered to work during opening hours.
Norma realises that this will be expensive in the short term, but she is confident that it will help to
increase the net profit of her business in the long term.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Identify evidence from the case study that shows that Norma Griggs is using a reactive approach
to change.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Inputs, processes and outputs are the key elements of an operations system.
Distinguish between the processes of a manufacturing business and the processes at Maxi Mini Golf,
a service business.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Describe how Norma Griggs could use Locke and Latham's Goal Setting Theory to motivate the
employees who remain at Maxi Mini Golf at the end of 2025.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Describe the way in which the principles of Senge's Learning Organisation could support the process of
change at Maxi Mini Golf.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Norma Griggs uses a consultative management style. Evaluate this management style given the nature
of the tasks that need to be completed at Maxi Mini Golf by the end of 2025.

Subject: Business Management
Content:
Explain how Norma Griggs could have applied the key principles of Lewin's Force Field Analysis theory
before deciding to have six new golf holes designed and installed.
